pageProps.content:
Experience

The remote Hoanib Valley Camp boasts a spectacular setting in the unspoilt Sesfontein Community Conservation Area in Namibia’s Kaokoveld.
The Kaokoveld is one of Southern Africa’s last untouched wilderness areas & home to a variety of wildlife, including the desert-adapted elephant, lion, oryx & springbok.
With breathtaking views over the never-ending dunes & picturesque Hoanib River Valley, a linear oasis of vegetation that runs through earth’s oldest wilderness – the Namib Desert – guests will be amazed at just how remote the camp’s location is.

Stay

Hoanib Valley Camp has 5 luxury tents as well as a 2-bedroom family tent, comprising of 2 adjoining tents.
Each luxury tent has an en-suite bathroom & private veranda that offers inviting views over the desert. The family unit has 2 en-suite bedrooms with private verandas – ideal for 2 adults & 2 children.
The communal area boasts an inviting tented lounge with a dining area where delicious dinners are served.

Activities

Activities at Hoanib Valley Camp include open 4x4 game drives & walking safaris where guests will learn more about local fauna & flora.
Since there are no other camps for miles & air pollution is minimal – stargazing in Damaraland is magical.
Village visits is a wonderful activity for guests looking to interact with local communities & learn more about their way of life.

subfolders.title: Camp Kipwe
subfolders.description: In the remote Twyfelfontein region of Namibia’s dramatic Damaraland, you will find the luxurious & intimate Camp Kipwe. The beautiful hut-styled camp is set amongst large boulders so that it blends in with the natural desert landscape.

subfolders.title: Damaraland Camp
subfolders.description: Damaraland Camp is situated in the Huab River Valley of Namibia, arguable the most pristine wilderness area in the country.   As one of the country's most loved camps, Damaraland Camp offers sensational views over the surrounding desert, valleys & mountains.

subfolders.title: Desert Rhino Camp
subfolders.description: Desert Rhino Camp lies in the 450,000 hectares Palmwag Concession in Namibia's Damaraland.   This region is marked for its tranquil, minimalist beauty, wealth of desert-adapted wildlife & the largest free-roaming black rhino population in Africa.

subfolders.title: Doro Nawas Camp
subfolders.description: Doro Nawas Camp is tucked away in the dry Aba-Huab River Valley in central Damaraland & commands magnificent mountain views to the north & red sandstone cliffs of Twyfelfontein to the south. The camp provides an excellent base for self-drive or fly-in guests wishing to explore one of Namibia's most remarkable areas.

subfolders.title: Etendeka Mountain Camp
subfolders.description: Amidst the raw & natural beauty of dramatic Damaraland in Namibia, lies Etendeka Mountain Camp. Rugged & untouched Damaraland is a place of dramatic boulders, beautiful mountains & an abundance of wildlife like African wildcats, aardwolves, mountain zebras & even the Big 5.

subfolders.title: Hoanib Valley Camp
subfolders.description: The remote Hoanib Valley Camp boasts a spectacular setting in the unspoilt Sesfontein Community Conservation Area in Namibia’s Kaokoveld. The Kaokoveld is one of Southern Africa’s last untouched wilderness areas & home to a variety of wildlife, including the desert-adapted elephant, lion, oryx & springbok.

subfolders.title: Mowani Mountain Camp
subfolders.description: Mowani Mountain Camp, as the name suggests, is perched on a high rock between a crescent of mountains in the Twyfelfontein Conservancy in Namibia. This remote desert area is known for its frequent sightings of the rare black rhino & the elusive desert elephant, making this one of Africa's most exciting safari destinations.
